questions.question: What is the most important part of the Capstone project?

options.text: Writing thousands of lines of code
Combining all the different concepts you've learned into one system

questions.explanation: The Capstone is designed to test your ability to integrate functions, classes, data structures, and file I/O.

questions.question: Which method is best for storing a complex game state that includes a player's inventory and current room?

options.text: Saving each item in a separate text file
Using a JSON file to store a dictionary of the state
Just printing it to the screen and asking the user to write it down

questions.explanation: JSON is perfect for preserving the structure of Python objects between game sessions.

questions.question: What should you do after completing this course?

options.text: Continue practicing and start a specialized learning path

questions.explanation: Programming is a skill that grows with practice. Transitioning to advanced or web topics is the next natural step.

questions.question: Arrange the final steps of your Python Basics journey:
questions.explanation: Finish your practical work, verify your knowledge, and keep moving forward!
